intro: Trichotosia unguiculata, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers clustered in umbels, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, containing cardiac glycosides. Trichotosia unguiculata is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates.
